Cheesecake

Let's get started!

Ingredients

Instructions:

  • 24 ounces (680g) cream cheese, softened
  • 1 cup granulated sugar
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 4 large eggs

For the crust:

  • 2 cups graham cracker crumbs
  • 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
  • 1/4 cup granulated sugar

For the topping (optional):

  • 1 cup sour cream
  • 2 tablespoons granulated sugar
  • 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
Instructions
  1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (160°C) and lightly grease a 9-inch springform pan.
  2. In a medium bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and sugar for the crust. Mix well until the crumbs are evenly coated.
  3. Press the crumb mixture into the bottom of the prepared springform pan, creating an even layer. You can use the back of a spoon or the bottom of a glass to press it down firmly.
  4. In a large mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla extract until smooth and creamy.
  5. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed to ensure everything is well incorporated.
  6. Pour the cream cheese mixture over the prepared crust in the springform pan.
  7. Smooth the top with a spatula or the back of a spoon, ensuring it's evenly distributed.
  8. Place the springform pan in the preheated oven and bake for approximately 55-60 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is slightly jiggly.
  9. While the cheesecake is baking, prepare the optional topping. In a small bowl, combine the sour cream, sugar, and vanilla extract. Mix well.
  10. After the initial baking time, remove the cheesecake from the oven and carefully spread the sour cream topping over the surface.
  11. Return the cheesecake to the oven and bake for an additional 5 minutes.
  12. Remove the cheesecake from the oven and let it cool in the pan on a wire rack for about an hour.
  13. Once cooled, refrigerate the cheesecake for at least 4 hours, or preferably overnight, to allow it to set.
  14. Prior to serving, gently remove the sides of the springform pan. You can run a knife around the edges of the cheesecake to loosen it if needed.
  15. Slice the cheesecake into desired portions and serve chilled.
Enjoy your homemade Cheesecake!
